This individual will work via email and telephone with the Ops teams across several countries and must have good writing and verbal skills. Use of multiple business intelligence tools to track and assemble reports for end users. Creation and development of Reports/Dashboards and carrying out statistical analysis and trend analysis of data. Creation of annual billing reports per agreements as needed. Close partnership with the San Diego Ops team for the creation of Salesforce Projects as needed and to capture customer support efforts. Working with IT to troubleshoot day to day end user issues with reporting tools (Salesforce/Qlikview). Candidate will use Excel and Powerpoint skills and should be highly detail oriented.

title: b'Research Data Analyst 1'
job description:
b"UCSD Layoff from Career Appointment: Apply by 3/19/20 for
consideration with preference for rehire. All layoff applicants should
contact their Employment Advisor.
Special Selection Applicants: Apply by 3/31/20. Eligible Special
Selection clients should contact their Disability Counselor for
assistance.

Description

===========
We are offering a fully-funded position for a data scientist to use
and develop strategies for the segmentation and analysis of biomedical
images (involving deep learning, high-throughput large scale data
analysis), with particular focus on brain wiring and synaptic
structures. Information about biological structures will be extracted
from microscopy images and parameters will be used to study
fundamental organization principles of the brain. The project will be
conducted at the National Center for Microscopy and Imaging Research
(NCMIR) at the UCSD School of Medicine. NCMIR is using cutting-edge
approaches for 3D microscopy of the cellular ultrastructure, applied
to neurobiology and cell biology, incorporating equipment and
developing software that expands the analysis of 3D structure.

Minimum Qualifications

======================

Bachelor's degree in related area and/or equivalent
experience/training.

Acquiring knowledge of research function. Acquiring ability to
perform research analysis duties.

Expertise in Python is essential, bash scripting.

Use of source control systems including Git will be required.

Experience with GitHub, Docker for reproducible code; Jupyter
notebooks.

Experience with image analysis packages (e.g. scikit-image,
OpenCV).

Acquiring statistical analysis, systems programming, and database
design skills to perform research analysis duties. Training in
Computer Science, Data Science, Computational Neuroscience or a
related field. Experience working with statistical software and
packages.

Ability to effectively manage time and see assigned parts of
projects through to completion on deadline.

Basic consultation and communication skills. Effective
communication and organization skills across domains as well as
the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Be highly
motivated, enthusiastic, and detail-oriented.

Must be opened to learning new techniques and methods. Strong
problem-solving and analytical skills and to work with a
scientific team supporting the throughput of neuroscience and
biology projects. A strong drive to enable open, reproducible
research.

Time-management, multitasking and the ability to work under
pressure in a fast-paced research program.

Preferred Qualifications

========================

Use or development of RESTful APIs.

Knowledge in C++, Java.

Biomedical image analysis software (Fiji, Amira).

Written and verbal fluency in both English and Spanish.
SPECIAL CONDITIONS
==================
Employment is subject to a criminal background check."

title: b'Data Analyst Contractor [Remote/Part Time]'
job description:
b'Data Analyst Contractor [Remote/Part Time]

About Us

Life360 brings families closer with smart tools designed to protect and connect the people who matter most.

Known for first-to-market solutions for modern family challenges, Life360 recently reached #1 in Apple's US App Store's list of free social networking apps. Nearly 1 in 10 US families with kids use Life360 an average of 12 times a day, and global membership is growing exponentially, with over 25 million monthly active users in over 140 countries \xe2\x80\x94 making Life360 the largest mobile service for families in the world.

This reach gives us the opportunity to do unprecedented good for families through our valued core offerings: advanced location sharing, private messaging, driver monitoring, help alerts, 24/7 roadside assistance, and Crash Detection with emergency response. On average we respond to 1,000 roadside assists and dispatch 200+ ambulances each month to those in need.

Offering both free and paid memberships. In addition, the company has raised over $200 million in equity financing, and recently completed an IPO on the ASX exchange \xe2\x80\x94 giving our employees the liquidity of a public company with the upside of a private growth stage business.

Life360's rapidly growing team of 150+ employees is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in San Diego, and Las Vegas.

About The Job

Data plays a crucial role in Life360's growth by driving smarter decisions, improving operations, and creating higher value user experiences. As an analytics team, we partner with a wide variety of cross-functional partners to apply data insights against strategic initiatives. "Know Our Users" is a Life360 core value and we're looking for analytics professionals who are passionate about leveraging user data to create value for Life360 families.

You'll be working in a dynamic growth environment, leading efforts to better understand the business, the product, and the customer. Life360 has one of the most interesting datasets in the world: location, driving, product usage, and purchasing behavioral data - all centered around who matters most, the family. If you have a passion for making an impact and working on products that help millions of families around the world, then this is the right place for you.

Responsibilities

In this role, we are looking for someone to be an analytics generalist and provide support for a variety of initiatives and teams. Projects will widely vary and we need someone who is willing to take on the task whether or not they have encountered that specific problem before. Ultimately, you will be tasked with finding data insights that deliver business value.

These Are Some Typical Responsibilities
Leverage data to understand the Life360 family and their product usage, developing insights that apply to product, marketing, and business strategy.
Partner with executives, product managers, engineers, marketers, designers to translate data insights into smarter decisions and applications.
Establish and manage KPIs that measure the health of the business, product performance, and customer experience quality.
Build dashboards and reporting processes to monitor business and product trends.
Develop frameworks, tools, and best practices to apply data insights towards business questions.
Conduct analyses and build models that identify opportunities and drive growth.
Design and analyze experiments, communicate results, and drive decisions.


Qualifications

We are looking for candidates with a diverse background that will compliment the skills and backgrounds of the current team. If you don't fit all the criteria below please apply anyway as this list is more of a preference rather than a rule. Our priority is for a well rounded team that delivers results.
We are looking for candidates who have had previous experience on analytics teams and are willing to help coach and mentor colleagues on best data practices. 3+ years is preferred.
Degree in a quantitative field like statistics, economics, applied math, operations research, or engineering, finance, business intelligence. Advanced degrees are preferred.
SQL expertise - able to write structured and efficient queries on large datasets.
Strong Proficiency in building data visualizations and interactive dashboards with tools like Tableau.
Experience in scripting languages, like analysis and visualization libraries in Python or R.
Strong verbal/written communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners to build the business.
Experience designing and evaluating experiments to draw inferential recommendations.
Curiosity to learn about new topics and uncover hidden insights.


PERKS
Fridays are Work From Home days at Life360
Competitive pay and benefits
Free snacks, drinks, and food in the office
Catered lunches throughout the week
Health, dental and vision insurance plans
401k plan
$200/month Quality of Life perk
A great office with plenty of light in the heart of the SOMA district in beautiful San Francisco
Whatever makes you stronger makes us stronger. We buy you the things you need to improve yourself and get your job done.

This position is remote.'

title: b'Data Technician/Analyst/Specialist'
job description:
b"Entry Technician

This is an entry level position and duties include working

into prescribed data formats. Submits recommendations for solutions. Prepares detailed

Job Posted by ApplicantPro"

title: b'DATA ANALYST'
job description:
b'Summary

We are looking for a true data enthusiast. Someone who knows how to tell a story by visualizing data in an accurate and easy to understand manner.

The Data Analyst is a part of the Analytics team and is someone who is inquisitive, systematic, creative and has a passion for the casino industry. Our Analysts work with parties all over the organization presenting BIG ideas to the Executive Team down to recommending process solutions for our smallest departments. We are the heartbeat of the Jamul Casino. We gather data from all aspects of the business to find meaning and purpose in order to drive profits. Our ideal candidate has the technical "know-how" to explore databases using SQL, transform and automate data pulls using Python, and build out meaningful interactive Tableau dashboards so that our internal customers can answer their problems quickly and easily.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

The following and other duties may be assigned as necessary:
Provide friendly, fast, and helpful customer service to all guests and team members.
Responsible for directing the overall operations and staff of the Analysis department. Develops, implements and manages operational goals and monitors achievements of performance and profit objectives.
Ensures that scheduling is done in an effective and efficient manner, while maintaining labor costs, meeting staffing objectives and achieving deadlines.
Responsible for preparing, monitoring and adhering to budgets and ensuring compliance to departmental budget initiatives. Reports budget concerns / deviations to the Executive Management / GM.
Proactively seeks out margin enhancement opportunities and provides recommendations with relative departments and implements change through data driven solutions.
Identify Market trends develop strategies to address potential concerns
Primarily responsible for short and long term financial analysis for the property including labor, and financial data reporting. Exercise discretion and independent.
Calculates profitability of marketing programs. Analyze results to identify opportunities for improving efficiency of marketing expenditures. Communicate findings to executive team.
Oversees all aspects of preparing the annual budget.
Compares actual operating results to budget and prior year. Summarize key findings and communicate to executive management. Make recommendation for improving EBITDA.
Develops presentations for budget meetings and operational reviews.
Presents and discusses analyses with high level executives.
Develops, maintains and distributes key operating metrics to evaluate attainment of company\xe2\x80\x99s operating, service and financial objectives.
Monitors labor costs and identify opportunities to improve efficiencies.
Performs queries of various databases to extract data for use in analysis.
Prepares ad-hoc analysis as needed.
Enthusiastically supports, actively promotes, and demonstrates superior customer service in accordance with department and company standards and programs. Ensures customer service standards are followed by all team members and addresses issues as they arise. Responsible for the overall achievement of department customer service goals.
Responsible for ensuring the compliance with all regulatory compliance within area of responsibility and reporting potential issues to Executive Management / GM.
Maintains strict confidentiality in all departmental and company matters.

Qualification Requirements

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be at least 21 years of age.
Bachelor's degree or higher from a four-year college or university in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience
Pursuing on-going skill development in the areas of financial modeling and analysis and project management.
At least 21 years of age.
Advanced skills in Tableau, SQL, Microsoft Excel, Access, and PowerPoint.
Advance knowledge of data analysis and automation principles.
Ability to collect relevant data, structure data models, execute and interpret quantitative data.
Self-directed and outgoing, highly skilled in financial modeling and BI programming, capable of handling high exposure projects, and receptive to coaching and feedback.
Ability to produce results by working within established time frames/deadlines and understanding potential barriers and next steps.
Proven ability to handle sensitive information in a confidential manner.
Ability to write effective reports and memos.
Excellent organizational skills.
Proven experience working in a methodical, and detail-oriented environment.

Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Language Skills

Ability to read and interpret documents in English, such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. Ability to read and communicate verbally in English. Written communication skills in in English may also be required.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS

Employee must be able to qualify for licenses and permits required by federal, state and local regulations.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and peripheral vision.

The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, and must have the ability to push, pull, reach, bend, twist, stoop, stack, crouch, kneel and balance when performing job duties in varying work areas such as confined spaces.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Employee could be exposed to an environment containing unrestricted second hand tobacco smoke.

ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

I understand that the company reserves the right to make changes to this job description as necessary or convenient. I further understand that nothing contained in this job description or contained in any revisions creates a contract, either express or implied, between the company and myself either for employment or for the providing of any benefits or compensation of any kind, unless made in writing by the General Manager. I acknowledge that receipt of this job description is not an offer or promise of employment and that if an offer of employment is extended and accepted, I will be employed as an \xe2\x80\x9cat will\xe2\x80\x9d team member and that as an \xe2\x80\x9cat will\xe2\x80\x9d team member, my employment is not guaranteed for a fixed period of time and it may be terminated by the company or by me at any time for any reason with or without notice.'

title: b'Senior QA Test & Automation Engineer (Data Analytics)'
job description:
b"Brain Corp is a San Diego-based AI company creating transformative core technology for the robotics industry. Our diverse engineering teams in Software, Hardware Design, and Embedded Systems are creating comprehensive solutions to support the builders of today's autonomous machines in successfully producing, deploying, and supporting commercial robots across industries and applications. Brain Corp is funded by the SoftBank Vision Fund and Qualcomm Ventures. For more information please visit: www.braincorp.com.

We are seeking a Senior Software QA Test & Automation Engineer (Data Analytics) who will design, develop, and oversee the execution of test protocols for functional verification and validation for autonomous mobile robots. This role works closely with internal teams across our Software and Hardware departments and will be directly involved in the innovation of next generation technologies. You will be directly responsible for maintaining the quality of our image processing/matching algorithms, evaluating partners tools, and supporting analytical data.

Tasks & Responsibilities
Execute manual and automated test suites
Implement test methodologies for testing and accuracy assessment for analytical data based on image processing
Create and maintain data pipelines and advanced analytics that capture data for reporting purposes using scripting languages such as Python
Build evaluations and metrics to quantify performance for multiple algorithmic data pipelines
Design and implement automated scalable tests to run in cloud against multiple data streams
Track and build databases with historical data and process them as needed for internal/external use
Create shareable test reports with metrics and visualizations
Investigate observed behaviors and gather diagnostic data to track issues to their source
Drive issues to closure by working with cross-functional teams


What You Need
BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Vision, AI, ML, Math, Physics or related fields
8+ plus years of professional experience as a Software Test Engineer with experience testing both software and hardware
Excellent programming skills, including proficiency in Python
Good understanding of structured and unstructured data: SQL, NoSQL, MySQL, etc
Knowledge of REST APIs and their usage

Things that make a difference
Experience with cloud computing (AWS, AZURE or similar)
Experience with computer vision, machine learning, and/or image processing (work with semantic segmentation, object detection, and image classification)
Strong knowledge of software development lifecycle, testing methodologies, QA terminology and processes
Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills, ability to describe and document clearly
Passion for quality, and exceptional attention to detail

This position is located at our San Diego headquarters and reports to the Director of Software Quality Assurance."

title: b'Senior Business Controls Analyst - Data Governance'
job description:
b'Caliber Home Loans, Inc. is one of the nation's fastest-growing mortgage lenders. We didn't move into the fast lane because of clever marketing campaigns or flashy television ads -- our talented employees worked hard to help us rise to the top of our industry.
Here at Caliber, we've replaced the stereotypical corporate culture with a casual "dress for your day" work atmosphere that promotes creativity and a collaborative environment that allows our team members to thrive.

Position Summary

Business Control personnel are responsible for the design, implementation, and oversight of a suite of surveillance activities designed to prevent and detect behaviors that may violate regulatory rules or internal policies and procedures. Business Controls is responsible for escalating the activity and working collaboratively with partners across the first and second lines of defense to determine the appropriate resolution of the matter, appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrate particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Caliber, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Responsibilities

The Sr. Business Controls Analyst, Data Governance is responsible for managing day-to-day operations that carry out the implementation of key risk programs, partnering with process owners and other lines of business to ensure CHL is in compliance with company policies, procedures, and all applicable laws, rules, regulations, including agency and investor requirements.

Identify and assess operational risk and impact and make recommendations for effective policies in order to manage risk.
Ensure all requirements from Risk, Compliance, Legal and HR have been incorporated into daily work flows.
Support the productivity, capacity management, and operational efficiency of business control operations.
Support all internal or external audits with the line of business to ensure execution of deliverables and action plans.
Partner with line of business to ensure strong investor relations with outside agencies.
Perform loan selection, workload assignments, and results review for assigned areas of responsibilities.
Assist in the preparation of Monthly Reports which track and monitor material, moderate, and recurring exceptions identified during the reviews.
Determine defect drivers and analyze root cause of the exceptions and communicate those to management.
Escalate QC concerns to senior management and report on progress as well as risks.
Participate in the review and development of new and/or revisions to existing policies and procedures.
Manage and oversee the vendor resources to ensure appropriate SLAs are met.
Provide support on escalated files and provide guidance on difficult transactions where necessary.
Coordinates training and counseling for managers and staff where applicable.
Provides oversight of operations managers and staff.
Develop, coach, and provide leadership to team members on clarifications, solutions, etc.
Perform other related duties as assigned by management.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree or equivelant experience
7+ years mortgage banking experience preferred
Diverse experience in all areas of mortgage operations including: processing, underwriting, closing, funding, and post
closing and servicing.
Familiar with FNMA/FHLMC, FHA, VA, MI and investor policies and guidelines.
Ability to effectively present information/respond to questions from managers, clients, customers and public.
Familiarity with various mortgage operations applications.
Ability to interpret guidelines and make decisions based on these interpretations.
Must possess advanced skills in applications including but not limited to, Sequel, Sharepoint, Microsoft Teams and Tableau
Ability to support Enterprise implementations
Full lifecycle project management skills
Requirement gathering and analysis
Support cross functions teams with reporting needs

Internal applicants must notify their current manager and one up prior to applying. See employee handbook for requirements.

Our employees demonstrate the Caliber Ways of Work (WOWS) every day through:

Collaborating Contagiously
Caring Fiercely
Doing the Right Thing
Leading Thoughtfully

Caliber benefits and perks will WOW you!
Our benefits package includes: comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, short-term and long-term disability, 401(k),10 employer paid holidays, as well as numerous employee discount programs.
We are proud to be a military friendly employer, and provide paid leave during military assignments for employees who serve in the Guard or Reserve.
Employees who work at our Coppell headquarters experience additional perks that include: standing desks, complementary coffee and tea stations, an on-site gym and activities center with ping-pong and pool tables, and an in-house caf\xc3\xa9.
Caliber is an equal opportunity employer.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled'

title: b'Data and Analytics Manager'
job description:
b'Education

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or similar Analytical discipline or equivalent experience.

Experience

At least 7 years of experience in data management or analysis.

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities
An analytical mindset with excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Strong leadership abilities to encourage collaboration, idea sharing, continuous learning and empowerment.
Ability to understand and translate complex ideas or problems clearly and in both technical and non-technical terms.
Ability to operate in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with tight deadlines.
Ability to assess and prioritize data and reporting issues according to their impact on the business.
Experience working with private and sensitive personal information .
Technical Skills: Advanced SQL, ETL and Data Modeling expertise with in-depth knowledge of DAX, M, XML, JSON.

Tools: Power BI, SQL Server, SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, Visual Studio, TFS, GitHub, Talend Data Integration and Data Quality

Environments: Office 365 and Azure and/or AWS data platforms.

Essential Duties
Lead a team of data, reporting and BI professionals to develop and implement processes and technologies aimed at data management (acquisition, integration, storage, architecture, validation and protection) and consumption of data through reporting, visualization and analysis.
Provide administration and data support for databases of core business applications.
Through direct partnerships with stakeholders: translate business, data and reporting requirements into logical data structures and solutions.
Provide recommendations for improvements and platform development to meet strategic objectives of the business.
Follow change management and standard development lifecycle processes.
Understand the existing business application landscape and legacy systems to support and evolve information and solution architecture .
Facilitate and maintain a data governance program and framework and promote governance through stewardship, awareness, and measurement of success.
Develop and own processes for evaluating and auditing data quality and providing direction to the business for improvement .
Provide processes and technologies that prevent access to sensitive or confidential information by unauthorized individuals.
Provide detailed documentation on data architecture, lineage, data definitions and data flows.'

title: b'Data Analyst - San Diego, CA'
job description:
b'Atlas Executive Consulting, LLC (Atlas), has an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst supporting the internal business operations team. This role will be responsible for analyzing processes, then designing, coding, and documenting reports, queries and dashboards to support the goals of the process owners. Flexibility in working with various departments is essential. If you are interested in working in a challenging and dynamic environment, this position will be perfect for you!

Responsibilities
Develop databases, data collection systems, data analytics processes and other strategies that optimize efficiency and data quality of departments.
Analyze confidential information according to guidelines.
Manage and design the Atlas reporting environment, including data sources and security infrastructure.
Design and implement a new data warehouse within Azure SQL.
Troubleshoot reports and data warehouse environments to address reporting discrepancies.
Train end users on how to use new reports and dashboards.
Providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
Gather and document business user requirements and design effective reporting solutions.
Develop and maintain dashboards using PowerBI and/or Tableau.
Research and recommend innovative approaches and best practices and standards within dashboard development and BI reporting.

title: b'Data Analyst'
job description:
b'This position will support data driven strategies for SAMAHAN HEALTH CENTERS. The Analyst will interact with multi-disciplinary teams to help define clinic needs and scope of services. This position will be accountable for building metrics to develop insights to drive continuous process improvements using data analytic methodologies. Able to work on multiple projects simultaneously with a keen desire to learn and expand depth of knowledge

title: b'Senior Data Analyst'
job description:
b'DynTek, Inc. currently has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst in San Diego, CA. The Data Analyst will contribute to the development and implementation data reports and strive to achieve consistent, effective reporting of system data. The Data Analyst shall be responsible for supporting the recording and analysis needs leading data, report, and report analysis activities, quality improvement, quality assurance, and compliance activities and the development of new reports (parameter reports, dashboards, and cubes). You will also be overseeing the review of system data to ensure consistent and effective reporting and the progression of data management maturity efforts. Additionally, you will be developing content for training and communication guides and coordinate data steward activities.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage metadata in support of the development and/or implementation of new data sources.
Develop and monitor a Data Management Maturity Gap Analysis and Road Map to include: Privacy, Security, Retention, Quality, and Standards.
Perform data analysis, gap and impact analysis \xe2\x80\x93 with a large number of data elements, one-to-multiple data sources, business impact, and visibility).
Use documented methods for creating source-to-target mapping, capturing business and technical metadata, and complete data lineage.
Prepare flow and organizational charts, workload statistics, and statistical data displays.
Perform data profiling, document results, and present findings to various audiences.
Lead the preparation of complex reports that communicate group/department priorities, policies, and procedures.
Prioritize current and future data projects.
Participate in special task forces.
Formulate criteria, processes, and procedures for evaluating the impacts of projects, plans, and programs for service delivery.
Conduct special projects that may include, but are not limited to, needs assessments, survey analyses, and program standard development.
Analyze patterns and prepares recommendations to enhance operational efficiency.
Make oral presentations.
Research and develop recommendations to improve outcomes.
Create data visualizations to clarify and inform a variety of audiences.
Collaborate with staff to create information graphics based on data analysis and findings.
Lead the design of data and ad hoc reports.
Lead the development of standard reports.
Lead training efforts within reporting \xe2\x80\x93 develop content for training and communication guides for reports.
Written or spoken communication materials on data reporting.
Develop project planning documents.
Update project status reports specified reporting tools
Monitor Master Data Management (MDM) design.
Monitor Business Intelligence strategies.
Monitor Change Management strategies.
Coordinate activities with vendors.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION:
\xc2\xb7       Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree, preferably in Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics or equivalent experience.
5+ years of experience in data analysis.
5+ years of experience in data warehouse.
5+ years of experience using advanced data analytic tools and in writing complex queries - Cognos Analytics, SPSS Modeler, and SQL experience preferred.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Quick learner, able to accurately assimilate and analyze information from a variety of sources and synthesize to produce consumable products.
Strong computer skills. Proven ability to learn new software systems. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Access.
Proven ability to demonstrate an understanding of data, data modeling, predictive analytics, and in showing how data supports business decisions.
Agile methodologies and tools.
Creative, focused, strong organizational skills, problem solver, attention to detail, flexible, and proactive.

DynTek provides Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.'

title: b'Data Analyst'
job description:
b'Are you interested in being challenged to create better solutions? Would you enjoy being part of an entrepreneurial company who believes in leveraging innovation and new ideas to improve results? Does the idea of developing something unique and impactful excite you? TechFlow\xe2\x80\x99s Platform Services team is highly skilled at solving the difficult problems people avoid and passionate about the exceptional work they deliver. As a company, TechFlow thrives on out-of-the-box thinking and the unique powerful expressions of our employee-owners.  We work hard to have an impact and make a difference in the world we share!

We are seeking to add an experienced Data Analyst to support an exciting opportunity with a new proactive approach. This hands-on position will work with our Program Management team to perform analysis on large amounts of data, create dynamic reports, work directly with technicians to correct data inconsistencies, and develop processes that begin to learn, reason and draw conclusions.   The ideal candidate will bring analytical rigor, statistical methods, reporting methodologies, new ideas and a positive proactive demeanor to drive continuous process improvement.

Interpret data and analyzing results using statistical techniques; develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Help define new and/or additional reports that monitor key performance indicators that drive services and overall business improvements.
Identify process gaps and work cross-functionally to formulate improvement plans.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Apply AI techniques to identify relevant service and delivery improvements.
Track and utilize system performance metrics to identify and prioritize improvement efforts.
Requirements:

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Information Management, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or Computer Science
2+ years experience as a data analyst
Experience performing quality control validation
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects), databases (SQL), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks)
Strong computer skills (e.g. data compilation, aggregation and presentation)
Problem solving and critical thinking skills combined with situational awareness and adaptability in the face of challenging circumstances
Excellent communication skills and a willingness to do what it takes to drive success
Must be a US Citizen with the ability to obtain a Public Trust Clearance Required
Things That Make a Difference:

CAP certification or Lean Six Sigma background a plus
This position reports to the Program Manager and ideally will work in either our San Diego headquarters or out of our Washington DC office. However, this position can telecommute.

Please Note:   TechFlow is an equal opportunity employer (Minority / Female / Disability / Vets). Applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and drug screen.'

title: b'Staff Business and Data Analyst'
job description:
b"Staff Business and Data Analyst
Santa Clara, CA, San Diego, CA

This position reports to: Senior Manager, Strategic Planning Analytics

ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.

As a member of the Product Operations Analytics team, you\xe2\x80\x99ll focus on driving operational awareness to our Executive Team while partnering with leaders throughout ServiceNow to fundamentally improve how we run our business. With a combination of exceptional analytical skills, an insatiable curiosity, and an entrepreneurial \xe2\x80\x9cget stuff done\xe2\x80\x9d mindset, you\xe2\x80\x99ll help us better understand our customers, partners, and products, and drive important changes that will shape the future of ServiceNow.

What You Get To Do In This Role

Analytics

We are looking for a Data Rockstar! An ideal candidate will have end to end experience in retrieving data using data mining languages (SQL/PLSQL, Python, etc.) and developing an effective executive level analytics dashboard that clearly communicates a clear data story. The work requires extensive experience in responsive visualization design, proficiency with interaction design and user interfaces and familiarity with mining and manipulating data.

The ideal candidate should have a background in analytics and statistics, the ability to foster relationships with staff across departments and be motivated to continuously achieve positive results. S/he should also be able to effectively handle ad hoc requests with little guidance.
Develop effective business intelligence strategies and analytics solutions.
Oversee analytics projects to extract, manage, and analyze data from multiple applications, ensuring that deadlines are met.
Apply statistics and data modeling to gain actionable business insights and boost productivity and revenue.
Enforce company policies and procedures to ensure quality and prevent discrepancies.
Communicate and track key performance metrics across departments.
Identify business opportunities and ensure customer satisfaction.
Generate reports of findings and present these to senior management.
Keep abreast of industry best practices and policies.
Generate insights and storylines through translation of metrics and a deep understanding of our internal processes, customers, and products
Present recommendations to senior leadership, and drive the \xe2\x80\x9cfollow through\xe2\x80\x9d of those recommendations to ensure smooth execution with a diverse array of cross-functional partners
Define critical KPIs and build core operating dashboards to help teams drive operational rigor and manage performance
Solve and present complex problems in an understandable way to stakeholders, business leaders, and executives
In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or similar focuses.
Minimum of 7 years of professional experience as an analyst with 5 years of those years in designing executive level dashboards
Expert knowledge of Tableau, MS Excel and other BI analytics tools.
Extensive knowledge of Tableau Server a plus.
Must have advanced level understanding of dashboard design.
Working knowledge of SQL (Impala), Python, SAP HANA, ETL, ELT, etc.
Working knowledge of big data instances: Cloudera, Azure, Snowflake, and the like.
Data Science and ServiceNow Performance Analytics experience preferred.
JavaScript Experience required.
Solid decision making, negotiation, and persuasion skills, often in ambiguous situations
Superior communication and presentation skills
Excellent leadership and organizational skills
Must be able to work in fast paced environment and be able to adopt to changing requirements.
Understanding of technology development projects and the full technology development lifecycle
Excellent communication and inter-personal skills.
Ability to travel approximately 10% of the time
We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business."

title: b'Data Analyst'
job description:

With a broad and ever-growing range of financial products, Axos Bank is rated among the top 5 online banks in the country! Partners with various GRC functional areas to define and implement TPR BSA reporting, dashboards and analytics

Create complex SQL queries involving multiple-table joins, union, sub-queries, CTE, temporary tables, and outer apply/cross apply
Develop advanced reporting and analysis through Microsoft SQL Server Report Builder and Tableau or other BI tools
Work with Deposits/Lending products and services
Strong Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and other Office products
Interface well with senior management and/or non-technical members of the team
Excellent written and verbal communication
Advanced technical skills, some project management capabilities

2+ years' with SQL (writing and optimizing SQL queries, customize SQL reports to support business requirements and analyze the data)
Familiarity and delivery of new K2 based workflows, Smart Forms, and Smart Objects using K2 Designer and K2 Studio
2+ years' financial services with understanding of core banking products, notably in the domains of money laundering, fraud, and risk management

CAMS, CFE, or CIA
Apply directly for consideration as we are not using any outside agencies for any of our openings

Pre-Employment Drug Test

All offers are contingent upon the candidate successfully passing a credit check, criminal background check, and pre-employment drug screening, which includes screening for marijuana. title: b'Liquidation Analyst'
job description:
b'Liquidation Analyst Job Responsibilities:
  The liquidations analyst will need to be skilled in developing modified payment/collection plans that may involve coordinating the repurchase of bonds used for original loan proceeds as necessary. He or she will prepare a Liquidation Plan and use the best strategy to maximize recovery on the loan. This may include foreclosure bids, purchase of notes, sale of notes, short sales, deferments, modification, preparing a litigation plan, negotiating Offers in Compromise and liquidation. The Liquidation Analyst will track bankruptcy proceedings as applicable, negotiate with borrowers, Third Party Lender, SBA, CRE Brokers, and attorneys etc. Also he or she will represent CDC in negotiations for Offers in Compromise and Short Sale transactions.
 
Job Duties:

Payment Collections

Payment Collections
Files will be transferred from Collections Agent to Liquidation Analyst. Some files will require higher level efforts at collections. The Liquidation Analyst has the capacity to develop modified payment plans as well as coordinating the repurchase of bonds used for original loan proceeds with justification.
  Preparing Liquidation Plans
Using information provided in the loan file and securing other necessary data, the Liquidation Analyst prepares a detailed Liquidation Plan that outlines his/her strategy to maximize recovery on the loan. The Plans present details of the transaction, analysis of collateral value and recommendations for securing recovery. Methods may include foreclosure bids, purchase of notes, sale of notes, deferment, modification and liquidation. The Liquidation Analyst submits the Plan to managers and SBA for approval and is responsible for tracking the status of multiple loan files and preparing loan documents as necessary. The Analyst is also required for tracking bankruptcy proceedings as applicable.

Negotiations
Most loan files require some negotiation with involved parties. These may include the borrower, Third Party Lender, SBA, CRE Brokers, etc. Liquidation Analysts may also represent CDC in negotiations for Offers in Compromise and Short Sale transactions.
  Management of REOs (Real Estate Owned)
Upon receipt of REO, all property management, insurance, repair and sale activities are managed by the Liquidation Analyst.

Desired Skills & Experience 

Minimum of 3 years of experience in a commercial loan servicing or liquidation capacity that required analytical functions. 
High degree of organization and strategic analysis capability. 
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to negotiate.
Alternatively, five years in commercial loan closing or title insurance position will be considered. 
Proficiency with MS Office applications.

Education
College degree is desirable.
 '

MBA with Engineering or Computer Science Degree (MSEE, MSCS, BSEE) -Experience in creating Statement of Work for Engineering Projects -Knowledge of Salesforce
Education

Strongly preferred: Bachelor's, Computer Science and/or Electrical Engineering
Preferred: Master's, Business Administration and/or Computer Science and/or Electrical Engineering

title: b'Research Data Analyst 1'
job description:
b"UCSD Layoff from Career Appointment: Apply by 3/19/20 for
consideration with preference for rehire. All layoff applicants should
contact their Employment Advisor.
Special Selection Applicants: Apply by 3/31/20. Eligible Special
Selection clients should contact their Disability Counselor for
assistance.

Description

===========
We are offering a fully-funded position for a data scientist to use
and develop strategies for the segmentation and analysis of biomedical
images (involving deep learning, high-throughput large scale data
analysis), with particular focus on brain wiring and synaptic
structures. Information about biological structures will be extracted
from microscopy images and parameters will be used to study
fundamental organization principles of the brain. The project will be
conducted at the National Center for Microscopy and Imaging Research
(NCMIR) at the UCSD School of Medicine. NCMIR is using cutting-edge
approaches for 3D microscopy of the cellular ultrastructure, applied
to neurobiology and cell biology, incorporating equipment and
developing software that expands the analysis of 3D structure.

Minimum Qualifications

======================

Bachelor's degree in related area and/or equivalent
experience/training.

Acquiring knowledge of research function. Acquiring ability to
perform research analysis duties.

Expertise in Python is essential, bash scripting.

Use of source control systems including Git will be required.

Experience with GitHub, Docker for reproducible code; Jupyter
notebooks.

Experience with image analysis packages (e.g. scikit-image,
OpenCV).

Acquiring statistical analysis, systems programming, and database
design skills to perform research analysis duties. Training in
Computer Science, Data Science, Computational Neuroscience or a
related field. Experience working with statistical software and
packages.

Ability to effectively manage time and see assigned parts of
projects through to completion on deadline.

Basic consultation and communication skills. Effective
communication and organization skills across domains as well as
the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Be highly
motivated, enthusiastic, and detail-oriented.

Must be opened to learning new techniques and methods. Strong
problem-solving and analytical skills and to work with a
scientific team supporting the throughput of neuroscience and
biology projects. A strong drive to enable open, reproducible
research.

Time-management, multitasking and the ability to work under
pressure in a fast-paced research program.

Preferred Qualifications

========================

Use or development of RESTful APIs.

Knowledge in C++, Java.

Biomedical image analysis software (Fiji, Amira).

Written and verbal fluency in both English and Spanish.
SPECIAL CONDITIONS
==================
Employment is subject to a criminal background check."

title: b'Data Analyst Contractor [Remote/Part Time]'
job description:
b'Data Analyst Contractor [Remote/Part Time]

About Us

Life360 brings families closer with smart tools designed to protect and connect the people who matter most.

Known for first-to-market solutions for modern family challenges, Life360 recently reached #1 in Apple's US App Store's list of free social networking apps. Nearly 1 in 10 US families with kids use Life360 an average of 12 times a day, and global membership is growing exponentially, with over 25 million monthly active users in over 140 countries \xe2\x80\x94 making Life360 the largest mobile service for families in the world.

This reach gives us the opportunity to do unprecedented good for families through our valued core offerings: advanced location sharing, private messaging, driver monitoring, help alerts, 24/7 roadside assistance, and Crash Detection with emergency response. On average we respond to 1,000 roadside assists and dispatch 200+ ambulances each month to those in need.

Offering both free and paid memberships. In addition, the company has raised over $200 million in equity financing, and recently completed an IPO on the ASX exchange \xe2\x80\x94 giving our employees the liquidity of a public company with the upside of a private growth stage business.

Life360's rapidly growing team of 150+ employees is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in San Diego, and Las Vegas.

About The Job

Data plays a crucial role in Life360's growth by driving smarter decisions, improving operations, and creating higher value user experiences. As an analytics team, we partner with a wide variety of cross-functional partners to apply data insights against strategic initiatives. "Know Our Users" is a Life360 core value and we're looking for analytics professionals who are passionate about leveraging user data to create value for Life360 families.

You'll be working in a dynamic growth environment, leading efforts to better understand the business, the product, and the customer. Life360 has one of the most interesting datasets in the world: location, driving, product usage, and purchasing behavioral data - all centered around who matters most, the family. If you have a passion for making an impact and working on products that help millions of families around the world, then this is the right place for you.

Responsibilities

In this role, we are looking for someone to be an analytics generalist and provide support for a variety of initiatives and teams. Projects will widely vary and we need someone who is willing to take on the task whether or not they have encountered that specific problem before. Ultimately, you will be tasked with finding data insights that deliver business value.

These Are Some Typical Responsibilities
Leverage data to understand the Life360 family and their product usage, developing insights that apply to product, marketing, and business strategy.
Partner with executives, product managers, engineers, marketers, designers to translate data insights into smarter decisions and applications.
Establish and manage KPIs that measure the health of the business, product performance, and customer experience quality.
Build dashboards and reporting processes to monitor business and product trends.
Develop frameworks, tools, and best practices to apply data insights towards business questions.
Conduct analyses and build models that identify opportunities and drive growth.
Design and analyze experiments, communicate results, and drive decisions.


Qualifications

We are looking for candidates with a diverse background that will compliment the skills and backgrounds of the current team. If you don't fit all the criteria below please apply anyway as this list is more of a preference rather than a rule. Our priority is for a well rounded team that delivers results.
We are looking for candidates who have had previous experience on analytics teams and are willing to help coach and mentor colleagues on best data practices. 3+ years is preferred.
Degree in a quantitative field like statistics, economics, applied math, operations research, or engineering, finance, business intelligence. Advanced degrees are preferred.
SQL expertise - able to write structured and efficient queries on large datasets.
Strong Proficiency in building data visualizations and interactive dashboards with tools like Tableau.
Experience in scripting languages, like analysis and visualization libraries in Python or R.
Strong verbal/written communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners to build the business.
Experience designing and evaluating experiments to draw inferential recommendations.
Curiosity to learn about new topics and uncover hidden insights.


PERKS
Fridays are Work From Home days at Life360
Competitive pay and benefits
Free snacks, drinks, and food in the office
Catered lunches throughout the week
Health, dental and vision insurance plans
401k plan
$200/month Quality of Life perk
A great office with plenty of light in the heart of the SOMA district in beautiful San Francisco
Whatever makes you stronger makes us stronger. We buy you the things you need to improve yourself and get your job done.

This position is remote.'

title: b'Data Technician/Analyst/Specialist'
job description:
b"Entry Technician

This is an entry level position and duties include working
independently or under general direction to perform analysis, preparation, and entry of data
into prescribed data formats. Submits recommendations for solutions. Prepares detailed
specifications and flowcharts. Prepares written reports to management.

Minimum/General Experience: High School diploma or equivalent and a minimum of 2
years of experience in a related field.

Analyst

General duties include data entry into government-specific software, review
and follow-up of database entries for tracking and proofing/verification, and report
generation and error checking as needed. This position requires accuracy in data entry, so
attention to detail is important; the ability to meet crucial deadlines; the ability to work with
numbers, financial information/documents; the ability to generate reports from government-specific software programs; and the ability to proofread and correct errors on financial
reports for accuracy.

Specialist

practices and recommends possible solutions. Reviews operations and testing of models to
ensure adequacy or to determine need for reformulating to support collection, manipulation,
analysis and other use of data.

Minimum/General Experience: A bachelor's degree or a minimum of 4 years of experience
in a related field.

Job Posted by ApplicantPro"

title: b'DATA ANALYST'
job description:
b'Summary

We are looking for a true data enthusiast. Someone who knows how to tell a story by visualizing data in an accurate and easy to understand manner.

The Data Analyst is a part of the Analytics team and is someone who is inquisitive, systematic, creative and has a passion for the casino industry. Our Analysts work with parties all over the organization presenting BIG ideas to the Executive Team down to recommending process solutions for our smallest departments. We are the heartbeat of the Jamul Casino. We gather data from all aspects of the business to find meaning and purpose in order to drive profits. Our ideal candidate has the technical "know-how" to explore databases using SQL, transform and automate data pulls using Python, and build out meaningful interactive Tableau dashboards so that our internal customers can answer their problems quickly and easily.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

The following and other duties may be assigned as necessary:
Provide friendly, fast, and helpful customer service to all guests and team members.
Responsible for directing the overall operations and staff of the Analysis department. Develops, implements and manages operational goals and monitors achievements of performance and profit objectives.
Ensures that scheduling is done in an effective and efficient manner, while maintaining labor costs, meeting staffing objectives and achieving deadlines.
Responsible for preparing, monitoring and adhering to budgets and ensuring compliance to departmental budget initiatives. Reports budget concerns / deviations to the Executive Management / GM.
Proactively seeks out margin enhancement opportunities and provides recommendations with relative departments and implements change through data driven solutions.
Identify Market trends develop strategies to address potential concerns
Primarily responsible for short and long term financial analysis for the property including labor, and financial data reporting. Exercise discretion and independent.
Calculates profitability of marketing programs. Analyze results to identify opportunities for improving efficiency of marketing expenditures. Communicate findings to executive team.
Oversees all aspects of preparing the annual budget.
Compares actual operating results to budget and prior year. Summarize key findings and communicate to executive management. Make recommendation for improving EBITDA.
Develops presentations for budget meetings and operational reviews.
Presents and discusses analyses with high level executives.
Develops, maintains and distributes key operating metrics to evaluate attainment of company\xe2\x80\x99s operating, service and financial objectives.
Monitors labor costs and identify opportunities to improve efficiencies.
Performs queries of various databases to extract data for use in analysis.
Prepares ad-hoc analysis as needed.
Enthusiastically supports, actively promotes, and demonstrates superior customer service in accordance with department and company standards and programs. Ensures customer service standards are followed by all team members and addresses issues as they arise. Responsible for the overall achievement of department customer service goals.
Responsible for ensuring the compliance with all regulatory compliance within area of responsibility and reporting potential issues to Executive Management / GM.
Maintains strict confidentiality in all departmental and company matters.

Qualification Requirements

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be at least 21 years of age.
Bachelor's degree or higher from a four-year college or university in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience
Pursuing on-going skill development in the areas of financial modeling and analysis and project management.
At least 21 years of age.
Advanced skills in Tableau, SQL, Microsoft Excel, Access, and PowerPoint.
Advance knowledge of data analysis and automation principles.
Ability to collect relevant data, structure data models, execute and interpret quantitative data.
Self-directed and outgoing, highly skilled in financial modeling and BI programming, capable of handling high exposure projects, and receptive to coaching and feedback.
Ability to produce results by working within established time frames/deadlines and understanding potential barriers and next steps.
Proven ability to handle sensitive information in a confidential manner.
Ability to write effective reports and memos.
Excellent organizational skills.
Proven experience working in a methodical, and detail-oriented environment.

Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Language Skills

Ability to read and interpret documents in English, such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. Ability to read and communicate verbally in English. Written communication skills in in English may also be required.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS

Employee must be able to qualify for licenses and permits required by federal, state and local regulations.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and peripheral vision.

The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, and must have the ability to push, pull, reach, bend, twist, stoop, stack, crouch, kneel and balance when performing job duties in varying work areas such as confined spaces.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Employee could be exposed to an environment containing unrestricted second hand tobacco smoke.

ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

I understand that the company reserves the right to make changes to this job description as necessary or convenient. I further understand that nothing contained in this job description or contained in any revisions creates a contract, either express or implied, between the company and myself either for employment or for the providing of any benefits or compensation of any kind, unless made in writing by the General Manager. I acknowledge that receipt of this job description is not an offer or promise of employment and that if an offer of employment is extended and accepted, I will be employed as an \xe2\x80\x9cat will\xe2\x80\x9d team member and that as an \xe2\x80\x9cat will\xe2\x80\x9d team member, my employment is not guaranteed for a fixed period of time and it may be terminated by the company or by me at any time for any reason with or without notice.'

title: b'Senior QA Test & Automation Engineer (Data Analytics)'
job description:
b"Brain Corp is a San Diego-based AI company creating transformative core technology for the robotics industry. Our diverse engineering teams in Software, Hardware Design, and Embedded Systems are creating comprehensive solutions to support the builders of today's autonomous machines in successfully producing, deploying, and supporting commercial robots across industries and applications. Brain Corp is funded by the SoftBank Vision Fund and Qualcomm Ventures. For more information please visit: www.braincorp.com.

We are seeking a Senior Software QA Test & Automation Engineer (Data Analytics) who will design, develop, and oversee the execution of test protocols for functional verification and validation for autonomous mobile robots. This role works closely with internal teams across our Software and Hardware departments and will be directly involved in the innovation of next generation technologies. You will be directly responsible for maintaining the quality of our image processing/matching algorithms, evaluating partners tools, and supporting analytical data.

Tasks & Responsibilities
Execute manual and automated test suites
Implement test methodologies for testing and accuracy assessment for analytical data based on image processing
Create and maintain data pipelines and advanced analytics that capture data for reporting purposes using scripting languages such as Python
Build evaluations and metrics to quantify performance for multiple algorithmic data pipelines
Design and implement automated scalable tests to run in cloud against multiple data streams
Track and build databases with historical data and process them as needed for internal/external use
Create shareable test reports with metrics and visualizations
Investigate observed behaviors and gather diagnostic data to track issues to their source
Drive issues to closure by working with cross-functional teams


What You Need
BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Vision, AI, ML, Math, Physics or related fields
8+ plus years of professional experience as a Software Test Engineer with experience testing both software and hardware
Excellent programming skills, including proficiency in Python
Good understanding of structured and unstructured data: SQL, NoSQL, MySQL, etc
Knowledge of REST APIs and their usage

Things that make a difference
Experience with cloud computing (AWS, AZURE or similar)
Experience with computer vision, machine learning, and/or image processing (work with semantic segmentation, object detection, and image classification)
Strong knowledge of software development lifecycle, testing methodologies, QA terminology and processes
Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills, ability to describe and document clearly
Passion for quality, and exceptional attention to detail

This position is located at our San Diego headquarters and reports to the Director of Software Quality Assurance."

title: b'Senior Business Controls Analyst - Data Governance'
job description:
b'Caliber Home Loans, Inc. is one of the nation's fastest-growing mortgage lenders. We didn't move into the fast lane because of clever marketing campaigns or flashy television ads -- our talented employees worked hard to help us rise to the top of our industry.
Here at Caliber, we've replaced the stereotypical corporate culture with a casual "dress for your day" work atmosphere that promotes creativity and a collaborative environment that allows our team members to thrive.

Position Summary

Business Control personnel are responsible for the design, implementation, and oversight of a suite of surveillance activities designed to prevent and detect behaviors that may violate regulatory rules or internal policies and procedures. Business Controls is responsible for escalating the activity and working collaboratively with partners across the first and second lines of defense to determine the appropriate resolution of the matter, appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrate particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Caliber, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Responsibilities

The Sr. Business Controls Analyst, Data Governance is responsible for managing day-to-day operations that carry out the implementation of key risk programs, partnering with process owners and other lines of business to ensure CHL is in compliance with company policies, procedures, and all applicable laws, rules, regulations, including agency and investor requirements.

Identify and assess operational risk and impact and make recommendations for effective policies in order to manage risk.
Ensure all requirements from Risk, Compliance, Legal and HR have been incorporated into daily work flows.
Support the productivity, capacity management, and operational efficiency of business control operations.
Support all internal or external audits with the line of business to ensure execution of deliverables and action plans.
Partner with line of business to ensure strong investor relations with outside agencies.
Perform loan selection, workload assignments, and results review for assigned areas of responsibilities.
Assist in the preparation of Monthly Reports which track and monitor material, moderate, and recurring exceptions identified during the reviews.
Determine defect drivers and analyze root cause of the exceptions and communicate those to management.
Escalate QC concerns to senior management and report on progress as well as risks.
Participate in the review and development of new and/or revisions to existing policies and procedures.
Manage and oversee the vendor resources to ensure appropriate SLAs are met.
Provide support on escalated files and provide guidance on difficult transactions where necessary.
Coordinates training and counseling for managers and staff where applicable.
Provides oversight of operations managers and staff.
Develop, coach, and provide leadership to team members on clarifications, solutions, etc.
Perform other related duties as assigned by management.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree or equivelant experience
7+ years mortgage banking experience preferred
Diverse experience in all areas of mortgage operations including: processing, underwriting, closing, funding, and post
closing and servicing.
Familiar with FNMA/FHLMC, FHA, VA, MI and investor policies and guidelines.
Ability to effectively present information/respond to questions from managers, clients, customers and public.
Familiarity with various mortgage operations applications.
Ability to interpret guidelines and make decisions based on these interpretations.
Must possess advanced skills in applications including but not limited to, Sequel, Sharepoint, Microsoft Teams and Tableau
Ability to support Enterprise implementations
Full lifecycle project management skills
Requirement gathering and analysis
Support cross functions teams with reporting needs

Internal applicants must notify their current manager and one up prior to applying. See employee handbook for requirements.

Our employees demonstrate the Caliber Ways of Work (WOWS) every day through:

Collaborating Contagiously
Caring Fiercely
Doing the Right Thing
Leading Thoughtfully

Caliber benefits and perks will WOW you!
Our benefits package includes: comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, short-term and long-term disability, 401(k),10 employer paid holidays, as well as numerous employee discount programs.
We are proud to be a military friendly employer, and provide paid leave during military assignments for employees who serve in the Guard or Reserve.
Employees who work at our Coppell headquarters experience additional perks that include: standing desks, complementary coffee and tea stations, an on-site gym and activities center with ping-pong and pool tables, and an in-house caf\xc3\xa9.
Caliber is an equal opportunity employer.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled'

title: b'Data and Analytics Manager'
job description:
b'Education

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or similar Analytical discipline or equivalent experience.

Experience

At least 7 years of experience in data management or analysis.

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities
An analytical mindset with excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Strong leadership abilities to encourage collaboration, idea sharing, continuous learning and empowerment.
Ability to understand and translate complex ideas or problems clearly and in both technical and non-technical terms.
Ability to operate in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with tight deadlines.
Ability to assess and prioritize data and reporting issues according to their impact on the business.
Experience working with private and sensitive personal information .
Technical Skills: Advanced SQL, ETL and Data Modeling expertise with in-depth knowledge of DAX, M, XML, JSON.

Tools: Power BI, SQL Server, SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, Visual Studio, TFS, GitHub, Talend Data Integration and Data Quality

Environments: Office 365 and Azure and/or AWS data platforms.

Essential Duties
Lead a team of data, reporting and BI professionals to develop and implement processes and technologies aimed at data management (acquisition, integration, storage, architecture, validation and protection) and consumption of data through reporting, visualization and analysis.
Provide administration and data support for databases of core business applications.
Through direct partnerships with stakeholders: translate business, data and reporting requirements into logical data structures and solutions.
Provide recommendations for improvements and platform development to meet strategic objectives of the business.
Follow change management and standard development lifecycle processes.
Understand the existing business application landscape and legacy systems to support and evolve information and solution architecture .
Facilitate and maintain a data governance program and framework and promote governance through stewardship, awareness, and measurement of success.
Develop and own processes for evaluating and auditing data quality and providing direction to the business for improvement .
Provide processes and technologies that prevent access to sensitive or confidential information by unauthorized individuals.
Provide detailed documentation on data architecture, lineage, data definitions and data flows.'

title: b'Data Analyst'
job description:

Location : San Diego, CA

Duration : 12 Months Contract

1 st Shift

title: b'Associate Product Manager - Data Analyst'
job description:

With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and AI, Tusimple is working to create the first commercially viable autonomous truck driving platform with L4 (SAE) levels of safety.

title: b'Data Analyst - San Diego, CA'
job description:
b'Atlas Executive Consulting, LLC (Atlas), has an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst supporting the internal business operations team. This role will be responsible for analyzing processes, then designing, coding, and documenting reports, queries and dashboards to support the goals of the process owners. Flexibility in working with various departments is essential. If you are interested in working in a challenging and dynamic environment, this position will be perfect for you!

Responsibilities
Develop databases, data collection systems, data analytics processes and other strategies that optimize efficiency and data quality of departments.
Analyze confidential information according to guidelines.
Manage and design the Atlas reporting environment, including data sources and security infrastructure.
Design and implement a new data warehouse within Azure SQL.
Troubleshoot reports and data warehouse environments to address reporting discrepancies.
Train end users on how to use new reports and dashboards.
Providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
Gather and document business user requirements and design effective reporting solutions.
Develop and maintain dashboards using PowerBI and/or Tableau.
Research and recommend innovative approaches and best practices and standards within dashboard development and BI reporting.
Perform ad-hoc queries in a variety of systems and tools.
Respond to quick-turn-around requests for data and information.
Work to resolve issues independently or escalate as appropriate.
Minimum Qualifications
BS in Computer Science, Mathematics or related degree.
1-2 years of work experience as a data analyst or related field.
Extensive experience writing SQL queries and stored procedures.
Experience designing and building reports, including visuals, with one of the following BI tools: Power BI, Tableau.
Proficiency in MS Excel (e.g., functions, pivots, macros); experience with Power Query or Power Pivot.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Must possess excellent problem-solving skills, and the self-motivation to improve skills.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Preferred Qualifications
SQL or related programming certification preferred.
Experience with AzureSQL.
* Ability to obtain a DoD Government Security Clearance is mandatory for this position*
Atlas, www.atlasexecutive.com, is a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business specializing in business management consulting to the Department of Defense and other Federal Agencies. Atlas was recently named one of Consulting Magazines 2017 seven Small Jewels, highlighting the growth and innovation the firm brings to market.
